sentence.Network_en: Finally, the author predicted the future trend of America's Unilateralism objectively.
sentence.Network_cn: 最后, 客观地预测了美国单边主义的未来走向.

sentence.Network_en: The struggles between multilateralism and unilateralism kept on going in the UN.
sentence.Network_cn: 联合国内多边主义与单边主义的斗争持续不断.

sentence.Network_en: Otherwise, any criticism would be blindness, or have unilateralism.
sentence.Network_cn: 否则任何批评将是无的放矢, 难免会有一定的片面性和盲目性.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 所谓单边主义(unilateralism)是指举足轻重的特定大国,不考虑大多数国家和民众的愿望,单独或带头退出或挑战已制订或商议好了的维护国际性、地区性、集体性和平、发展、.

entry.def: Unilateralism is the belief that one country should get rid of all its own nuclear weapons, without waiting for other countries to do the same.

Unilateralism is used to refer to a policy in which one country or group involved in a situation takes a decision or action on its own, without the agreement of the other countries or groups involved.

example.ex: ...the recent history of American aggressive unilateralism on trade.
example.tran: 美国在贸易上奉行咄咄逼人的单边主义的近一段历史

means.word_mean: 1. the doctrine that nations should conduct their foreign affairs individualistically without the advice or involvement of other nations
